shaking unintentionally, he poured too many drops into the glass. He threw the mixture on- to the floor and asked for some more water. The maid brought it. 
There were in the room a child's cot, two boxes, two armchairs, a table, a child's table, and the little chair on which Prince Andrew was sitting. The curtains were drawn, and a single candle was burningon the table, screened by a bound music book so that the light did not fall on the cot.
